info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 02 at 5:31PM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northwestern Laurens, southeastern Greenville, central Spartanburg, northeastern Anderson and west central Cherokee Counties through 615 PM EDT... At 531 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 8 miles northwest of Spartanburg to 10 miles southeast of Easley. Movement was east at 10 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Greenville Downtown, Spartanburg, Greenville Eastside, Greer, Mauldin, Taylors, Simpsonville, Five Forks, Fountain Inn and Piedmont. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
